text: The weak can never break out of their own mold. They cry piteously within their cells, while they try to kick down anyone who strives to break free.

author: Murasaki
title: Hamatora: The Animation
text: You chose to go with the flow and you think that doesn't make you guilty?

author: Aizawa Yuuichi
title: Kanon
text: Every dream has an end...No matter how nice the dream might be, or how scary it is. Under your warm blanket, the dream comes to an abrupt end, when mother shakes you awake. Forever and ever, the morning scene remains the same. But now I... I wonder... when the dreams began to never end.

author: Shiori Misaka
title: Kanon
text: It's called a miracle because it doesn't happen.

author: Koyomi Araragi
title: Bakemonogatari
text: If you're going to selfishly admire someone only to be disillusioned later, then maybe you shouldn't try to get to know them better at all.

author: Akihiko Usami
title: Junjou Romantica
text: When you love someone, I think it's only natural to worry about what they love.

author: Koyomi Araragi
title: Bakemonogatari
text: You may be unfortunate, but that doesn't mean you have to suffer. You may not be blessed, but that doesn't mean you have to throw a fit over it. Even if bad things happen to you, just be strong!

author: Izaya Orihara
title: Durarara!!
text: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.

author: Mikoto Kujou
title: Last Game
text: After all the hiding your true self, even if you eventually become popular, won't you just feel exhausted by it in the end?

author: Minori Kushieda
title: Toradora!
text: I don't want to get so caught up in searching for what I can't see, that I lose sight of what I can.

author: Mikoto Kujou
title: Last Game
text: I don't care if you're the son of the president or what. That just shows the success of your father. It doesn't mean you are excellent too.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru.
text: There was no meaning to things that were only superficial. That was a single belief that both me and her once shared.

author: Mark Kluger
title: Inazuma Eleven
text: Certain individuals can change the entire outlook of the team with their overwhelming abilities.

author: Pharos
title: Persona 3
text: Time is something no one can escape. It delivers us all to the same end.

author: Minori Kushieda
title: Toradora!
text: My happiness can only be... can only be made with my own hands! My happiness doesn't depend on anyone but me!

author: Zen Wistalia
title: Akagami no Shirayukihime
text: If people scrutinize you, just ignore them and do whatever you want to do.

author: Brook
title: One Piece
text: "Loneliness" is no longer part of my vocabulary.

author: Brook
title: One Piece
text: Death is never an apology.

author: Minori Kushieda
title: Toradora!
text: I believe in ghosts, even though I've never seen one before and get this. I don't believe in anyone of the people that have said they seen one before. It's kind of like how I think about the concept of love. Like I believe one day I'll fall in love, get married and live happily ever after, even though I've never actually fallen in love with anyone yet. You see what I'm saying? For some people falling in love is like second nature, but I can't even relate to that. So if I've never fallen in love before is it real? And that makes me wonder if ghost are real. I haven't seen one yet so maybe they're not.

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Those who can't do what they have to when the time comes for action will find their presence fading in our classroom. An assassin who neglects to sharpen his blade is no assassin at all. He's just a boastful brat swinging around a rusty sword.

author: Ainz Ooal Gown
title: Overlord
text: It's fine. Everyone makes mistakes. You just need to make an effort not to make the same mistake again.

author: Dyne Woodwonder
title: Overlord
text: The words you've said cannot be taken back. So you must take action to paint over what you have already said.

author: Classroom Crisis
title: Classroom Crisis
text: The most certain way to succeed is to try one more time. Our greatest weakness lies in giving up.

author: Yuuji Kazami
title: Grisaia no Kajitsu
text: There are only two times when a man can cry in public: when he loses his wallet and when his mother dies. And even if you cry in private, there's a severe restriction. Shed tears for others. The only thing you should be shedding for yourself is sweat. Remember that.

author: Lelouch Lamperouge
title: Code Geass: Akito the Exiled
text: The ideal tool for controlling people is fear. And nothing overwhelms people more than an unseen fear.

author: Mutta Namba
title: Uchuu Kyoudai
text: There are people who don't know you, who are saying a lot of awful things. But just saying stuff is easy, and anyone can do it. However...There's no one out there who could take your place.

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: The difference between the novice and the master is that the master has failed more times than the novice has tried.

author: Grizzly-san
title: Polar Bear's Café
text: You're not supposed to find yourself, you're supposed to choose yourself!

author: One Piece
title: One Piece
text: If you hurt somebody or if someone hurts you, - the same red blood will be shed.

author: Trafalgar Law
title: One Piece
text: There are things you can't see unless you change your standing.

author: Erza Scarlet
title: Fairy Tail
text: If the drive behind one's actions is the thought for another, then it is never meaningless.

author: Shinichi Okazaki
title: NANA
text: It's dangerous here. If you stare at the stars long enough, you start thinking you could grab one, and you get this feeling like all your dreams will come true.

author: Klaus von Reinherz
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: You're not a coward. I know that because you haven't given up yet. You're standing here. As long as you face the light and take even one step, the human soul can never truly be defeated.

author: Akihiko Usami
title: Junjou Romantica
text: When you fight hard and fail, the regret is easier to get past than the regret of not trying.

author: Koyomi Araragi
title: Bakemonogatari
text: If they find out what you did there, a lot of people will say a lot of things to you. Some will say you did the right thing. And some will say you did the wrong thing. But that's not what matters. No matter what anyone says, you don't have to worry. Because you didn't do the right thing, and you didn't do the wrong thing. It was all part of being young.

author: One Piece
title: One Piece
text: They are more like “people who don't follow rules…” There are different kinds of people in different worlds! … Between you two and them, what is the difference? It isn't unusual… to put it to an extreme… A hero during a war would be just another murderer in peaceful times.

author: Meia Gisborn
title: Vandread
text: Regardless of what happens our lives are finite. We all know that we will grow old and that someday our lives will end. That's why we try so hard to live each day to the fullest. That's why we keep stumbling on by trial and error. But it isn't just for ourselves, it's so we can leave some signposts for the people following in our foot steps. To cowards who cling to where they are and who have given up on trying to move forward there is no way to see how bright the future is even though it's just around the corner!

author: Hibiki Tokai
title: Vandread
text: You can worry about things all you want, but it doesn't mean you'll always get an answer. What's important to remember, is that when it's all said and done and you got through it all somehow, are you the person you wanted to be?

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru.
text: Everyone is a slave to their past. No matter how much you wish to move forward, the events of last year will bear down on you like the light of the stars as soon as you glance up. Unable to laugh or to banish your past, you carry it ceaselessly in a corner of your heart, waiting for it to resurrect at an inopportune moment.

author: Shōkichi Naruko
title: Yowamushi Pedal
text: To stop or to keep going? The one who decides is yourself.

author: Yato
title: Noragami
text: You shouldn't judge people by how they look.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: It is better to be hated for what you are. Than to be loved for what you are not.

author: Kouji Aiba
title: Infinite Ryvius
text: There's a limit to the strength of people who are isolated. If we do the best we can we should be fine. We don't grab a hold of the entire future. Let's just think about grabbing tomorrow. I think that's plenty for us, don't you?

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: The Devil's finest trick is to persuade you that he does not exist.

author: Gilgamesh
title: Fate Stay Night - Unlimited Blade Works
text: The things we can't obtain are the most beautiful ones.

author: Ciel Phantomhive
title: Kuroshitsuji
text: We have no need for the past. All we need are the present and the future.

author: Kouji Aiba
title: Infinite Ryvius
text: I think that sometimes things just won't go the way we want them to. And every day there's bound to be something that makes us mad when there's nothing we can do to change the state of affairs. But that's not entirely true, either. We have to give these kinds of things some real thought as well. If we're sitting back and waiting for the future to arrive - we don't have anything invested in tomorrow. I don't want a tomorrow like that.

author: Kojirō Shinomiya
title: Shokugeki no Sōma
text: If you want to grow just look above you, there are plenty of people perfect to serve as fodder for your growth.

author: Crocodile
title: One Piece
text: Wake up princess, I'm tired of your useless ideals. It's gotten pathetic. What good are your happy ideals if you can't do anything to make them a reality? They're nothing but dreams, and your dreams don't stand a chance.

author: Ganju Shiba
title: Bleach
text: I think you and I have different concepts of beauty. I was taught that it's beautiful to survive, unsightly or not.

author: Ciel Phantomhive
title: Kuroshitsuji: Book of Murder
text: There's nothing more deceiving than an obvious truth.

author: Kisaragi Shintaro
title: Kagerou Days
text: The smile of you, who flew through this window and died, I won't ever forget, not even tomorrow.

author: Zen Wistalia
title: Akagami no Shirayukihime
text: The only one who should decide which path to follow is yourself.

author: Subarashii Sekai
title: Subarashii Sekai
text: The time when you're happy is also the time when you're afraid that the happiness will end.

author: Ada Vessalius
title: Pandora Hearts
text: What is really wicked... is judging people without even trying to get to know them!

author: Eucliwood Hellscythe
title: Kore Wa Zombie Desu Ka?
text: Today's my birthday. During times like these I always think whether or not it was a good thing that I was born.

author: Jimbei
title: One Piece
text: It is a sad truth that greater the authority a person possesses, the more he tends to fear change.

author: Simon Brezhnev
title: Durarara!!
text: You're happy enough, so don't take away the happiness of others. You should share it.

author: Marida Cruz
title: Mobile Suit Gundam UC
text: Kindness alone can't save people. It can't erase sin or wash away the impurities.

author: Himura Yuu
title: ef - a tale of memories
text: This world revolves around two views on the same thing. In addition, it's about laughable miseries.

author: Yasaburou Shimogamo
title: Uchouten Kazoku
text: There are all sorts of goodbyes. There are sad goodbyes, and sometimes goodbyes you're thankful for, that take a load off your mind. It often happens that someone you say goodbye to unexpectedly returns, all self-conscious. Then there are times when, anticipating that, you put on the front of a short goodbye, only to have them not return so soon. And then there are goodbyes that last forever, true goodbyes that only happen once in your life.

author: Shizuka Hiratsuka
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Your impression of people is renewed every day. As you spend time with them and grow with them, you come to understand more.

author: Yumiko Sakaki
title: Grisaia no Rakuen
text: They say that in hard times, you'll never in your life forget the person who gave you a cup of water.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: There are people who ruin the atmosphere just by existing, you know.

author: Yuuji Kazami
title: Grisaia no Rakuen
text: Skilled only at making excuses that justify nothing, he is someone whose life has no value. The same goes for me. I have the right to stop you because I'm just like you.

author: Nora Floriann Leoria
title: The World God Only Knows
text: When you compare love and hate in this world... There is a lot more hate than love, and it's much stronger. So, if we consider every one of them as hate, we'll be right most of the time. I don't have time to pick out the truth anyway.

author: Takeshi Nanase
title: Magical Warfare
text: There're too many people who worry about the things I don't worry about.

author: Yuuji Kazami
title: Grisaia no Rakuen
text: To ensure that all I've done won't end up a lie. I don't want to talk big game to people, then run away when it matters the most. This is a wall I must overcome on my own. If there's anything I want to change, I have to change myself. If I must become evil to defeat evil, I will become the devil himself. That's all to it.

author: Hyuuga Junpei
title: Kuroko No Basket
text: Don't go believing everyone with glasses is smart!

author: Taiga Kagami
title: Kuroko No Basket
text: If we understood how other people felt, then nobody would ever start wars!

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru
text:
As they say about the vulgar masses, the more people flock to a group, the more foolish they become. No matter how prominent an individual is, no, it's because he is prominent that he would be blotted out by the sheer force of numbers when thrown into that lump of people. Individual will, qualifications, and personality, let alone emotions aren't considered at all.
We see only what we want to see, listen only to what we want to listen to, but for the things we want to say, we aren't able to. This is the society that we're living in right now.

author: Naruo Taneda
title: Solanin
text: When you're sincere about doing something, you're stalked by the fear that there's no turning back.

author: Noboru Taki
title: Hibike! Euphonium
text: Music isn't supposed to be something you do to show off your abilities to your rivals.

author: Kumiko Oumae
title: Hibike! Euphonium
text: People aren't complicated. We work hard when we know that we'll get something in return, and we try to work even harder if that something is our own improvement.

author: Brook
title: One Piece
text: What do you know of death?!! Have you ever died?!! You think death will preserve your cause forever?!! Ridiculous!! Death leaves nothing behind!! Once a person passes on, nothing remains but dead bones!! If there is one thing I can't stand, it is a person with no respect for life!!

author: Brook
title: One Piece
text: Neither God nor the Devil can give aid to those without the will to fight…

author: Arlong
title: One Piece
text: Living is important! It is because one lives, one can enjoy things! Everyone has their own designated place and position in life! This man understands the futility of resisting against that fact! You see, not all living things, are born equal!

author: Frau
title: 07 Ghost
text: Don't allow hatred to devour your heart. The one that you care for will only move farther away.

author: Hakuren Oak
title: 07 Ghost
text: Not fighting frantically for your life is all right, too. The important thing is… to decide on your own what you should do.

author: Sister Libelle
title: 07 Ghost
text: The human heart will always sway. And only then do we know that it is truly a human heart.

author: Teito Klein
title: 07 Ghost
text: Daunting and mistrusting others forever won't accomplish anything.

author: Frau
title: 07 Ghost
text: There isn't just one truth. That truth only exists because a few people saw it. If you don't believe what the books say, then you should go see the world for yourself.

author: Maiko Shuu
title: Nisekoi
text: I've decided to take this unrequited love, and quietly put it away in a corner of my heart as a bittersweet page of my youth.

author: Medusa Gorgon
title: Soul Eater
text: Fear is what creates order.

author: Tsugumi Seishirou
title: Nisekoi
text: It can't be helped, if there's nothing you can do, then there's nothing else you can do.

author: Konno Yuuki
title: Sword Art Online II
text:
Because of my last moments are such fulfillment.
I can end my journey surrounded by so many people, in the arms of the person I love.
I... I did my best to live, I lived here.

author: Subarashii Sekai
title: Subarashii Sekai
text: This world that we live in is gentle yet sad, fun yet sorrowful, strong yet ephemeral... ...but as long as you're alive, something good is bound to happen. I'm sure of it.

author: Gintoki Sakata
title: Gintama
text: You yourself have to change first, or nothing will change for you!

author: Gintoki Sakata
title: Gintama
text: Sake sure is nice. You can forget your troubles if only for a moment. You'll have to remember them tomorrow though, and they'll be even more painful than they were the night before. You can't run away from things like this. Especially from things you really want to forget.

author: Tsukiko Tsutsukakushi
title: Hentai Ouji To Warawanai Neko
text: Ash to ashes, dust to dust, trash to trash can and useless people to uselessness box.

author: Gaap
title: Umineko no Naku Koro ni
text: 'Slacking off' sounds bad. However, enjoying more of your day with the time you saved by doing your job in a clever way is definitely not a bad thing. Times like that are what makes a human's life rich. If you exaggerate, it could be called laziness, surely. However, people only become mature when they are able to balance work with enjoyment. In short, if all you care about is your job, you're not fully mature.

author: Shoot McMahon
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: I've always gone to any lengths to avoid facing danger and risk, hiding myself within  a safe cage, where no one could hurt me. I hated myself for it.. But I couldn't change myself.. Friends and teachers encouraged me, but I never truly listened, considering it the logic of the strong. Yet somehow... A boy with less than half my strength managed to break my cage!

author: Yui Yuigahama
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Why is it that what I want, and what's expected of me are so similar, yet so different?

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Honestly, there isn't much meaning to the splendid names given to you by your parents. What does have meaning, is what the person behind that name does during their actual lifetime. The name doesn't make the person. The name simply remains gently within the footprint left on the path a person walks.

author: Smoker
title: One Piece
text: Don't ever think there's any perfect society made by humans!! If you think that way you'll overlook the enemy!! Don't be fooled by appearances!!

author: Gon Freecss
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: In my next life, I want to be me, and meet you again.

author: Gilgamesh
title: Fate Stay Night - Unlimited Blade Works
text: "Hero of Justice? A world where no one is hurt?" Don't be absurd. "Humanity" is the name for an animal that cannot find joy in life without sacrifice. The pretty lie that is "equality" is nonsense spouted by weaklings who cannot look upon the darkness. Nothing but an excuse to cover up life's ugliness.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: "True to herself", "True to myself". We all have our own personal image that's dictated by others, one that's always off the mark. We wish to remain true to ourselves, but who gets to decide who we are as people? When our image never goes hand-in-hand with reality, where can we find something genuine? Where can we find our true selves?

author: Shizuka Hiratsuka
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: People usually don't look back to see how far they've come while they're still walking. Of course, when they come to a standstill, the more progress they've made, the more betrayed they feel by their expectations.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: The past makes you wanna die out of regret and future makes you depressed out of anxiety. So by elimination, the present is likely the happiest time.

author: Gintoki Sakata
title: Gintama
text: Don't worry. When people break their old selves they embark a journey to find their new selves.

author: Minato
title: Houkago no Pleiades
text: Hope brings me pain... if I didn't have any hope at all, I might never have known such agony.

author: Keima Katsuragi
title: The World God Only Knows
text: There's no use in just creating "Love". Empty hearts filled with "Love" tend to be unstable.

author: Michiru Kinushima
title: Plastic Memories
text: It's more cruel to give someone false hope, you know.

author: William Macbeth
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: Everyone thinks at some point if what they are doing has any meaning or not. Will the day come when I get what's coming to me, or not? How much influence does my existence have on the world at all, or doesn't it?

author: Tsubasa Hanekawa
title: Monogatari Series: Second Season
text: Someone saying that they are happy doesn't necessarily mean that they are happy, right?

author: Tooru Kazasumi
title: Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation
text: If another me was born somewhere else, and had led a different life, how would he feel? If there was another version of myself somewhere on the other side of the ocean, what would happen if I were able to meet him? Would I be able to be his friend? Or would the differences in our upbringing be something that I couldn't overcome? Can I understand him because he is me? Or will he be impossible to understand because he's me?

author: Deishū Kaiki
title: Monogatari Series: Second Season
text: Romance can strengthen people, but it can also make them useless.

author: Kyouka Katagiri
title: Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation
text: We fail. We make mistakes. But each time we do, I think we become stronger.

author: TimeKeeper
title: Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation
text: Humans continue to live in a cycle of death and destruction. Guns can't change anything. It merely creates an infinite chain of hatred and retribution.

author: Isla
title: Plastic Memories
text: Because nothing makes one happier than being with the one you love.

author: Tooru Kazasumi
title: Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation
text: Pain, suffering, sadness... We all accept it, and that's why we can move forward!

author: Su-won
title: Akatsuki no Yona
text: However, even if it is reckless... I don't think someone who is making their best effort to try and break through the current situation is foolish.

author: Takeshi Yamamoto
title: Katekyo Hitman Reborn!
text:
When you're really in trouble, of course I'd come and help.
That's what friends are for, right?

author: Yuki Nagato
title: The Disappearance of Nagato Yuki-chan
text: That, I don't want to do. You may feel that I'm currently an abnormal Nagato Yuki. That judgement is correct. But I myself cannot accept that I am abnormal... because if I do, I'll become alone. I was scared, so I tried to hide it.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: When people reach the halfway mark of a long ordeal, how do they feel? Does being only halfway there make them despair? Or do they feel relief at making it halfway there? Most people have to feel one way or the other, and both emotions create an opening in their hearts. That's why I pushed myself this far.

author: Hayato Hayama
title: Yahari Ore No Seishun Love Come Wa Machigatteiru
text: When you pick the only option you have to choose from, can you really call that your own decision?

author: Kazuki Kuwanomi
title: Plastic Memories
text: That's human nature. We have regrets, and go on blaming ourselves forever.

author: Vali Lucifer
title: High School DxD BorN
text: What you think of as peace can be painful for others.

author: Mato Kuroi
title: Black Rock Shooter
text: Love is a bitter sweet taste of life, which many humans many weaknesses and sometimes their strongest weapon.

author: Kuchiki Byakuya
title: Bleach
text: Sovereignty means absolutely nothing in front of me.

author: Akari Mizunashi
title: Aria the Animation
text: If one feels it is fun now, one will be able to enjoy life the most. Everything will change over time, so we must treasure the happy moments before us.

author: Kazuma Mikura
title: Air Gear
text: If training hard can make you number one, then how many number one do you think this world will have!?

author: Koyomi Araragi
title: Nisemonogatari
text: It isn't just "others". Not "others". It's my Family. I'll force my ideals on my family. And since they're family, I'll lie to them. I'll deceive them. I'll cause them trouble. I'll make them worry. I'll owe them things, things I'll never be able to repay. However, I think that's okay. If you say that being an impostor is evil, then I will shoulder the burden of that evil. If lying is a bad thing, then I'm fine being the bad person. I don't need them to like me. I'm fine with being the worst kind of person.

author: Tsubaki Sawabe
title: Shigatsu Wa Kimi No Uso
text: I don't like this, I don't like this, I don't like this. Sure, I know that I have no right to be feeling this way. But I still don't like it! I just don't like it. We were always together. I was always by his side. During time of joy, and grief as well. But...I realize he's far away from me now... I'm not by his side...there's somebody else there... I don't like this! Look at me! Look at me, will you? Not with those eyes... Don't look at someone else!

author: Kawayanagi Tsurezure
title: Ojojojo
text: That's probably true. I like talking with people. I wonder if speaking with me is boring though. Since once people talk to me, they'll never do it again. But I don't feel like starting a conversation either, since in the direction I ought to look, there are only people who I cannot talk to. That's why I look at the sky... It's strange how merely observing things can be so handy to kill time. It hurts that I get called a weirdo just for making a habit out of it and in the end it just makes me stare at the sky even more. I've probably always been like this. Thinking about it, there's nothing I can do about my passiveness. Waiting things out is just my nature. I'm sure that... things will get better someday...

author: Takeo Gouda
title: Ore Monogatari!!
text: People are born into this world. And people are taken from this world.

author: Amu Hinamori
title: Shugo Chara
text: If you don't believe in yourself, who will!? You're the only one demeaning yourself!

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text:
You can't take back the answer you already gave out. There's no use in crying over spilt milk. The egg you broke won't come back. All the horses and soldiers of a king will never return to his side again.
It doesn't matter what was said. You can never wipe away a bad impression.
Even though the opposite is so simple in comparison. Just one word will make someone appear hateful. Just doing one thing would make you seem hateful.
That's why excuses are meaningless. Because even those excuses will make you look hateful.

author: Komachi Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Identity? What? The people who yap about identities all the time are usually the ones with no identity. Like something that changes so easily could really be an "identity", anyway.

author: Misogi Kumagawa
title: Medaka Box
text: I want to beat them. Even though I'm not cool, or strong, or just, or beautiful, or cute, or pretty, I want to beat the cool, strong, just, beautiful, cute, and pretty people. Even though I wasn't blessed with talent, even though I'm stupid and have a bad personality, have bad grades, am misguided and am a good for nothing, I want to beat the talented, smart, likeable, overachieving people. I want to beat those with friends when I can't have friends. I want to beat the people who work hard when I can't work hard. I want to beat the the victorious people when I can't win. I want to beat the happy people when I'm miserable. Even if I'm hated, even if I'm despised, even if I'm useless, I want to prove that I'm better than the main characters!

author: Tsubaki Sawabe
title: Shigatsu Wa Kimi No Uso
text: Even though I'm bitter over losing, even though I'm depressed, even though my ankle hurts, and my eyes are smeared with tears...even though I've never felt worse...I wonder why the stars are sparkling like this. The scent of the music room in his hair. I can hear his slightly ragged breathing. His shoulder, wet with tears, is so warm. I am by his side. I wish time would just stand still.

author: Kawayanagi Tsurezure
title: Ojojojo
text: Whatever. It's okay, isn't it? Being dishonest with your feelings is part of who you are. If that would just suddenly change overnight, you'd be a different person.

author: TimeKeeper
title: Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation
text: To believe in someone can be a dangerous thing.

author: Tachikoma
title: Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex
text: Maybe, just maybe, it's a concept that's similar to a zero in mathematics. In other words, it's a symbol that denies the absence of meaning, the meaning that's necessitated by the delineation of one system from another. In analog, that's God. In digital, that's zero.

author: Karoku Arumerita
title: Karneval
text: But the truth is merely the majority of the living. It only revolves around their choices and actions and nothing more.

author: Blake Belladonna
title: RWBY
text: Unfortunately, the real world isn't the same as a fairy tale.

author: Train Heartnet
title: Black Cat
text: The past isn't something you can just throw away. It stays with us forever. It's the same for everyone. We must live on, and carry the burdens of the past with us. That's why it's important that you carry the burden of what you do now and how you've decided to live your life today.

author: Monokuma
title: Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei
text: Everyone's birthplace and upbringing is different. It's obviously impossible for them to understand each other.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: If wishes could be granted, if desires could be fulfilled,  then I wouldn't wish or desire for anything after all. The things you're handed on a silver platter are never genuine, and never everlasting. And that is why I'll always keep searching.

author: Kamijou Touma
title: Toaru Majutsu no Index
text: This is your life right? Then decide for yourself! If you want to protect everything with your hands then do so, if you want to abandon everything then do so. But, what do you yourself want to do right now? Can you really be satisfied giving someone else that you don't really understand your most important thing?

author: Akiyama Shinichi
title: Liar Game
text: Now, you've only got two different options to choose from: Prove that everything I just said was bullshit, or admit your guilt.

author: Emiya Shirou
title: Fate/stay night
text: I don't mind losing to someone, but I won't be beaten by myself.

author: Shizuka Hiratsuka
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: It is impossible to not hurt someone. Humans unconsciously hurt others by simply existing. Whether you are alive or dead, you keep hurting people. Getting involved will hurt them, but trying not to get involved might hurt them too. But if it's someone you don't care about, you won't notice you've hurt them. What's important is your awareness of it. It's because you care about them, that you feel like you've hurt them. Caring about someone means being resolved to the fact that you'll hurt them. The more people care for each other, the farther out of reach certain things get. But that's not something to be sad about, I think it's probably something to be proud of.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Thinking you'll understand without being told anything is an illusion.

author: Michiru Kinushima
title: Plastic Memories
text: Losing sight of who you really are... that can be pretty scary.

author: Tooru Kazasumi
title: Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation
text: It has happened many times throughout history. Resources, territory, wealth... Humans fight each other in order to gain something they don't have. It's simple. How can you be concerned with the lives of others when you're about to starve to death? You're too naive. Humans can only live by stealing what they don't have from others. If there's no future, we just take the future from others.

author: Amane Suou
title: Grisaia no Rakuen
text: All I ever gained from abandoning something and running away were regrets I couldn't do anything about, and a version of myself that could only resent others. If I come to hate myself, even living becomes a sin. Remorse alone will become my punishment. That's why I've decided to take action of my own free will, so I'll never have the same regrets again.

author: Tomoya Aki
title: Saenai Heroine no Sodatekata
text: They're human beings who are more appealing that real girls with warm blood flowing through their veins! That's what you have to be!

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Don't put me on their level. I don't care about looking interesting. I'm just self-conscious.

author: Klaus von Reinherz
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: Step one foot outside, and with one pull of a trigger, you can inflict a fatal injury; with one push of a button, you can blow up a whole lot of people at once. The world truly is a cavalcade of efficiency in violence. Still... whether hacking each other with stone axes, cutting each other with swords, shooting each other with guns, cursing each other with magic, or taking aim at each other with missiles, for some reason, there's a craving that grips us, from which we can't evolve away.

author: Tomoya Aki
title: Saenai Heroine no Sodatekata
text: You're the idiot. 3D girls are way too much trouble. The first is "the most beautiful girl in school", which is a dating sim trope that doesn't exist in reality. The second is having two of the "most beautiful girl in school" is contradictory. And the third is the wildly mistaken notion that a 2D-only otaku like me could possibly have a 3D girlfriend.

author: Imizu Asuhi
title: Mikagura School Suite
text: Even a dim star is sending light somewhere.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: It's arrogant to think just saying things out loud is enough. Self-gratifying on the part of the speaker, and conceited on the part of the listener. You won't always come to an understanding by talking things out.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Expecting others to read your mind is delusional. But... But... I... I..."It's not empty words I'm after. There was something else I desired all along. Not mutual understanding, friendship, companionship, or anything of the sort. I don't care about being understood. I simply wish to understand. Understand, know, and rest easy in that knowledge-- gain some peace of mind. Wanting to know people inside-out because being in the dark terrifies me is an awfully self-indulgement, egoistic, and arrogant wish. It's downright despicable and disgusting. Having a desire like that makes me sick to the stomach! But if it's at all possible to share that desire-- if it's possible to have a relationship where you're free to burden one another with that repulsive self-gratification...I know that it's out of the question! I know that it's out of my reach! Even so!" Even so, I... I want something genuine.

author: Gintama
title: Gintama
text: When you are down, how do you pick yourself up? People fall into two categories... depending on how they pick themselves up. The first one sees somebody who is worse off and thinks, "Hey! I am better off than that guy." And the second kind of guy sees a challenge and tries to raise himself to it.

author: Monokuma
title: Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei
text: You know, isn't it said that life has its ups and downs? It's fun because downs come after ups, but if life was full of downs, wouldn't it get boring?

author: Moral
title: Hamatora: The Animation
text: All human beings can only perceive the world through the filter of their values. Mediocre values may be harmless, but they are also utterly worthless.

author: Ryou Haruna
title: Eden*
text: There's no need to rush. Sometimes even pointless conversations can teach you a thing or two.

author: Natsume
title: Eden*
text: Everyone's reality is freight with some degree of pain. What's wrong with seeing what makes you happy in your dreams?

author: Alibaba Saluja
title: Magi - The Labyrinth of Magic
text: Friends are like balloons. Once you let them go, you can't get them back. So I'm going to tie you to my heart, so to never lose you.

author: Azuma Yunoki
title: La Corda D'Oro - primo passo
text: It's harder to fool one's self than to fool others.

author: Natsume
title: Eden*
text: Even now, she continues to burn away her life in order to bring about a beginning rather than an end... She just looks forward while dreaming of the outside world. But you know what I think? Isn't it a bad thing to just look forward? Sometimes looking to the side, or looking back... There just might be something important there. You may have lost something. There may be the smile of a loved one. Isn't it impotant to try looking around once in a while? That's how it was for me. I could only ever face forward, could only move my legs with reckless abandon. I never had any idea what sort of footprints I might be leaving behind me. No, in truth, I couldn't even look ahead. The fact that I've never seen anything was scary... so I went on a trip to find what I truly desired.

author: Keima Katsuragi
title: The World God Only Knows
text: That's not love... A heroine's love is supposed to be sincere! If you can immediately move on and find someone new, it isn't love!

author: Nai
title: Karneval
text: Sorry, but I hate people who act innocent but are actually opportunists.

author: Keima Katsuragi
title: The World God Only Knows
text: If you come across an event that's too good to be true, it's probably poison.

author: Kyōko Kirigiri
title: Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei
text: Also, the "fear" experience is a little different from yours, I imagine. You're afraid of what you might lose, right? But I'm afraid of what I've already lost.

author: Monokuma
title: Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei
text: So everyone just pretends to understand... and pretends to be understood.

author: Shizuka Hiratsuka
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: People's thoughts don't always mirror how they feel. That's why they sometimes make decisions that seem nonsensical.

author: Monokuma
title: Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei
text: A suicide means you've killed the most important existence of all: yourself.

author: Ophelia
title: Claymore
text: It's truly infuriating... I despise people like you who put their own lives in jeopardy for some glorious, hopeless cause.

author: Accelerator
title: Toaru Majutsu no Index
text: Listen, even if someone is suffering before you, the kind of person that can take up arms without hesitation to shoot down the villain is no better than a villain himself. The kind that doesn't care about others, doesn't give 2nd chances; someone that kills if given a reason, is definitely not a hero. You don't have to become that kind of person. That's my specialty. Only I have to go through that.

author: Iori Nagase
title: Kokoro Connect
text: What are people? What is the "self"? So long as you look like someone else, no one can't tell who's really on the inside.

author: Tomomi Masaoka
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: People's thoughts, wishes, hopes and desires... We live in a time where technology can read everything in your mind, and yet, this place teems with people who hate, lie, steal and try to harm others. If that's not irrational, then what is it?

author: Makishima Shougo
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: A beautiful flower too will eventually wither and fall. That's the fate of all living beings. If that's the case, it's only natural for one to want to stop the time while they're still blossoming in all full glory.

author: Kino
title: Kino No Tabi
text: Being able to forget things you want to forget, and being able to remember things you want to remember, is such a great thing, you know?

author: Moeka Kiryū
title: Steins;Gate
text: That day four years ago... When I wasn't needed by anyone. When nobody cared about me. When I had given up on living and was about to jump off the roof of a building... FB saved me with a single message. I didn't care if it was a joke or not. I was just happy that somebody knew... that I was alive... that it was OK for me to live...

author: Asakura Ryouko
title: The Disappearance of Nagato Yuki-chan
text: Applying knowledge is of the utmost importance when studying. You wrestle with various things and come up with a solution from there. It's true that asking someone who knows the answer is the quickest. But you can't necessarily say that that's the best way, don't you think?

author: Makishima Shougo
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: Overall, I think people tend to reveal their true selves when they step into an avatar. As I said earlier, they probably feel some sense of freedom. But freedom easily gained quickly turns into a false sense of omnipotence.

author: Naoto Inaba
title: Eden*
text: Everyone lives their own way. Whether you live for yourself or live for others... that is your own decision. A life of earnestly protecting and tending to someone isn't bad either. Though it's not that glorious of a life.

author: Tifa Lockhart
title: Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children
text: Stop running! I know. Even if you find the kids, you might not be able to help them. Maybe something could happen that can never unhappen. That scares you, doesn't it? But you need to think about now. Really take it in! Look at you: you think you've got it so damn hard. Well, you hate being alone, so let people in! Sure, you may not answer the phone, but I don't see you throwing it away, either!

author: Matsushima Michiru
title: Grisaia no Rakuen
text: I don't like sparklers all that much. It burns so beautifully for just a little while and when it's done, only black cinders remain. It's like a misbegotten life and it makes me feel lonely for no good reason.

author: Taichi Yaegashi
title: Kokoro Connect
text: Everyone has different faces.

author: Nagisa Shiota
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Anything can be a sword if you polish it enough.

author: Tsumugu Kihara
title: Nagi no Asukara
text: You probably do lose a lot, but that just means you need to fill what you lost with new things.

author: Chisaki Hiradaira
title: Nagi no Asukara
text: I wasn't scared that I'd be rejected, I was scared that if I said how I felt, all of our relationships would change.

author: Makishima Shougo
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: Most people don't mind killing cows and chickens but they'd probably have a hard time doing the same to chimpanzees. Partially, it's because chimpanzees bear a slight resemblance to humans, but the primary reason is that they can draw pictures. Suppose fish were able to draw pictures. Even if we are unable to understand what they're thinking, it becomes harder to kill animals that can draw. Instinctively, in our minds we would say to ourselves… “May be they have feelings” That shows how high a value we assign to expression.

author: Ulquiorra Schiffer
title: Bleach: Official Character Book 3 UNMASKED
text: What is there, over there? There is nothing. I was born in a bottom of a pit where no light shone. As if pressed together by the darkness. Untouched by everything at all. Born under those dark, dark sediments. I had a white form. My comrades were all in pure black. In those black forms with their eyes shining and teeth baring they were certainly eating something. And then... There was nothing to me, except my eyes. I felt nothing. No rather... It was possible that what I felt was "void", yet. I could hear nothing, I could bite nothing, I could smell nothing, I could feel nothing as I touch, I could not rest. I had no companion. Just walking, alone. The things reflected in my eyes have no meaning. The things that could not be reflected in my eyes do not exist. Walking walking walking walking walking walking walking walking. When I had arrived at last. I have found something extraordinary. It was somewhat the place of birth for those strange translucent objects that dotted this world. It was the first time... my eyes have been captured. With no colour, with no sound, with no scent. Does not interact with anything, it only exists there. It was the closest existence to "void" that I had ever laid eyes on. I sank my body... into... that great "void". There was nothing there,... Even I had lost my line of vision, and dissolved into the void... And felt as if everything had disappeared. Happiness. If such a thing called happiness exists in this world, it should be something which resembles the limitless nothingness. Nihility is having nothing, and having nothing to lose. If that isn't "happiness", then what is? The things reflected in my eyes have no meaning. The things that could not be reflected in my eyes, do not exist. There is nothing... in you... and... in me.

author: Kyōko Kirigiri
title: Danganronpa: Kibou No Gakuen To Zetsubou No Koukousei
text: Fear is proof that your imagination is functioning. Frankly, I feel bad for anyone who can't feel fear. Without imagination, you can never deduce which action to take next.

author: Makoto Sunakawa
title: Ore Monogatari!!
text:
Just because someone's friends with a nice person doesn't mean they're nice, too. 
Sometimes they're friends because the person's nice enough to have them.

author: Madera
title: Shining Hearts
text: There's some skill involved in the creation of anything. That skill is like a map made of the failures people have made in the past and learned from. That map can guide people. If you follow a certain route you'll fail. However, if you follow a different route you'll succeed. You can make something just by following the map. It will take form. It might be very hard task to walk the way others have told you. But if you have the will, it might turn out to be easy. But if you follow the path created by others, you'll eventually have to stop somewhere. Then what will you do? Will you create a new path for yourself? Or will you wait until someone creates one for you? Either one is fine. Stopping or moving forward. Because the path you'll follow is something you have to choose for yourself.

author: Hotaru Takegawa
title: Hotarubi no Mori e
text: I probably won't be able to look forward to summer for a long time. My chest will hurt. My tears will be overflowing. But this warmth in my hands and these summer memories will live on in my heart.

author: Kei Takishima
title: Special A
text: Nothing interesting ever happens. It's the same everyday.

author: Yukino Yukinoshita
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: If this is all it takes to tear us apart, then maybe we weren't all that close to begin with.

author: Moeka Kiryū
title: Steins;Gate
text: (In Gamma worldline, to Okabe) Look, even if we were enemies in the world you were before, right now I'm your only ally. Even if the whole world turned against you, I would continue to be your only ally.

author: Tomomi Masaoka
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: Everything you've been taught is based on theories and logic. Soon you will likely come to realize how pointless they are in the world we live in.

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Exams are an opportunity to teach correctly the meaning of winning and losing, of strong and weak. Students soak up heaping helpings of successes and setbacks! Take in now what it means to win, what it means to lose!

author: Moeka Kiryū
title: Steins;Gate
text: When I realized, I was already on the roof of a building. ...I had come to hate everything. I was sick of sitting in my room holding my knees too. If nobody was going to notice or care if I died then... what's the point in living?

author: Mary Macbeth
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: Even now, twenty centuries after the death of Christ, the world is a long way from peace.

author: Klaus von Reinherz
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: People are weak. Because of their weakness, they sometimes behave in ways devoid of self-respect. But then, so what if they do, my old friend? Even if I am struck with a thousand setbacks... it does not serve as a reason to alter the way I live... my life!

author: Mary Macbeth
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: Don't you think it's futile to live in fear of death? I mean, everyone is going to die sometime, so is there any point in pretending not to see it for the present? Or instead, I wonder if they think it doesn't concern them, since they aren't going to die.

author: Karma Akabane
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Total victory is scoring an easy win by doing what you always do.

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Tests are a good thing. The knowledge gained from a night of cramming will be all but forgotten once you hit adulthood. And that's fine. The experience you gain through competition, having sharpened your skills and broadened your minds all under the same set of rules? That's the real treasure.

author: Makishima Shougo
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: Suppose someone said "humans are foolish"... Obviously, that person would be talking about themselves as well. If you want to understand human beings, you need to do more than just watch them. You need to pay attention to what they themselves are watching. What are you watching? You are the ones who I'm watching. It may be hard to believe, but I like you guys. You know what they say... The opposite of love is not hatred, but indifference. An indifferent person would lack the drive to kill or hurt. My mind keeps jumping around. Am I nervous...? Did I underestimate my enemy so much that I stepped in too deep...? ...What a silly thought.

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: It's dangerous for them to grow up without experiencing true competition. Because they'll keep whining, even without taking the matter seriously. For those with a high level of aptitude... The sooner they know the frustration of defeat, the greater their growth will be.

author: Tifa Lockhart
title: Final Fantasy VII
text: People have many things pent up inside of themselves.

author: Kumin Tsuyuri
title: Chuunibyou Demo Koi Ga Shitai!
text: Do you know how they say that love is like a dream? With a dream, you eventually wake up from it. It's hard to force yourself to wake up.

author: Izaya Orihara
title: Durarara!!
text: Have you ever thought about why you're so good and your parents are so bad? If you'd so kindly let me give away the answer; it's because even if you're cheating on someone or you're being cheated on, everyone laughs at bad jokes and eats over-sweet boiled vegetables.

author: Johnny Beppu
title: Aikatsu!
text: Become an idol who can laugh through the bitterness. If you do that, you can make everyone happy.

author: Tohsaka Tokiomi
title: Fate/zero
text: Taking responsibility for yourself is the first condition for humanity. One who cannot do even that is less than human. Just a dog, Kariya.

author: Elica
title: Eden*
text: Chains can be torn off. Your sister knew that. Be it an artificially produced human or a wild animal stained by sin... I believe that all living things have the right to be happy.

author: Korosensei
title: Assassination Classroom
text: Please remember that there are times to take someone's hand and lead them along... But also times when you must be stern and let them fend for themselves.

author: Mei Tachibana
title: Sukitte Ii Na Yo
text: We all have our scars from loving someone too deeply, from wanting to protect  someone too much.

author: Lucy Ashley
title: Fairy Tail
text: If one really wants to change the world...they have to do it by their own hands!

author: Lilith Bristol
title: Absolute Duo
text: If you try to acquire something, you'll lose something else along the way. That's the truth of this world. No matter how sad it is.

author: Ringo Noyamano
title: Air Gear
text: When a person is hard to reach, someone has to extend their hand to that person to get to them, because of that dream, because they dream that freedom really exists, the roses will look up at the sky when they bloom.

author: Itsuki Minami
title: Air Gear
text: There's something you can't see unless you're standing at the top, to experience that for the first time, I'm struggling to a higher place than anyone else, isn't that what freedom is?

author: Ringo Noyamano
title: Air Gear
text: From this day on, I don't need freedom. As we struggle using our strength to grasp what's above us. We will eventually reach something, that is the meaning of the word freedom.

author: Itsuki Minami
title: Air Gear
text: A long time there... There was a balloon man, right? When I first heard that story, I was so stupid that I actually enjoyed it... But really, the story was horrible. Driven solely by his dreams he used his balloons to disapear into the sky. The people watching made a big fuss about it... But no one really tried to stop it. There's no telling where the wind will take you. And he knew that one day his fuel, his ''freedom'' would run out, and he'd fall into the black ocean. To fly... that feeling is the most important thing. But instead of the dark clouds that drive people from the sky... There must be a chain to keep them grounded. The time will come, for those with the ability to fly away, while everyone else can only watch. Using their own wings, their own power... soaring as far as they can without aid. Because... Because that is what it means to fly.

author: Ringo Noyamano
title: Air Gear
text: The desire to fly with ''real wings'' is what motivates you.

author: Itsuki Minami
title: Air Gear
text: So I'll search for my real ''wings'', because if I stay in the comfort of my nest, I'll never be able to use my own strength to fly.

author: Koumei Ren
title: Magi - The Labyrinth of Magic
text: Plainly speaking war is nothing other than "wanting to impose your beliefs on your opponent." It only happens for that reason. You don't have any exception to that rule.

author: Sion
title: Eden*
text: Even if they are locked in cage, as long as they have wings, birds can dream of the wide-open sky. But.. If their wings are plucked, they will cease to be birds...

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: There are people who can't act unless they're faced with a problem. Unless they find their reason. All I was left with was the sinking suspicion that I'd gone horribly wrong.

author: Isla
title: Plastic Memories
text: Having happy and beautiful memories won't always bring you salvation. The more beautiful a memory is, the more painful it can become. It can even become terrifying. Both for the one who's leaving... And for the one left behind.

author: Cadis Etrama Di Raizel
title: Noblesse
text: Not every result can be the one desired. Trust your own judgments and actions. That is enough.

author: Leonardo Watch
title: Kekkai Sensen
text: Once you get used to the abnormalities, they become mundane.

author: Sakurako Amamiya
title: Psyren
text: Regret is a powerful poison. The more you harbor those thoughts, the harder it is to move on.

author: Yuri Nakamura
title: Angel Beats!
text: Let me tell you something. Humans don't even have the patience to wait even ten minutes for something!

author: Takahiro Mizuno
title: Walkure Romanze
text: There are some things you'll never see if you're always running.

author: Akane Ryūzōji
title: Walkure Romanze
text: Sometimes opportunity comes in sacrifice.

author: Takahiro Mizuno
title: Walkure Romanze
text: If fate were real, then I would say meeting someone new would constitute such a thing.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: So long as a problem doesn't cause problems, it can't be called a problem.

author: Lisa Eostre
title: Walkure Romanze
text: There's a thin line between recklessness and courage.

author: Cthuko
title: Haiyore! Nyaruko-san
text: Becoming an adult is such a sad thing. If you have something dear to protect, you may end up at odds with yourself.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: If they're not given a problem, if they're unable to find a reason, some people can't bring themselves to act. Maybe I got something wrong somewhere. Only that bit of doubt stayed with me.

author: Hikari Sakishima
title: Nagi no Asukara
text: I don't want to see any more things that've changed! It's exhausting!

author: Karyuudo Tsukishima
title: Mirai Nikki
text: Those who seem kindest, are often the most insidiously cruel.

author: Chisaki Hiradaira
title: Nagi no Asukara
text: Does becoming adult mean you lose a lot of things?

author: Re-L Mayer
title: Ergo Proxy
text: The only thing waiting for you outside is a world of death.

author: Ame Ochibana
title: Denpa teki na Kanojo
text: The fastest way to happiness is to avoid looking at reality.

author: Accelerator
title: Toaru Majutsu no Index
text: I have no interest in being a villain, and I don't think that I can become a good person. I'm at a halfway point where I'm not even sure which path I should walk down… but I guess even there, I can still interfere in someone's life and help bring things to a positive conclusion…

author: Oz Vessalius
title: Pandora Hearts
text: Instead of sighing about the past, I'd rather be happy to face the present.

author: Ciel Phantomhive
title: Kuroshitsuji
text: To hate something that you used to love is such a painful feeling.

author: Ichinose Hayato
title: Uta No Prince Sama
text: Everyone loses sight of themselves sometimes. Don't worry about it.

author: Accelerator
title: Toaru Majutsu no Index
text: I'm too naive. With thoughts like "If I saved someone maybe I can start all over again."

author: Ciel Phantomhive
title: Kuroshitsuji
text: Love means money these days.

author: L-elf Karlstein
title: Valvrave the Liberator
text: This isn't a situation where you can stand on principle. If there's something you want to protect, get your hands dirty.

author: Senator Figaro
title: Valvrave the Liberator
text: Running away isn't the same thing as losing. You only truly lose by dying. So as long you're alive, you win.

author: Sephiroth
title: Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children
text: Whether your words...are lies created to deceive me... or the truth that I have sought all my life... It makes no difference. You will rot.

author: Zack Fair
title: Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children
text: If people had wings... They'd be monsters.

author: Tifa Lockhart
title: Final Fantasy VII
text: A memory is something that is consciously recalled, right? That's why sometimes, it can be mistaken or wrong. It's different from a memory locked deep within your heart.

author: Tomoko Kuroki
title: WATAMOTE
text: Romance is all about how far you'll go to prove your love. Finding a person who's worth the effort is pure luck. You just gotta wait for the right hurricane to sweep you off your feet.

author: Ada Vessalius
title: Pandora Hearts
text: What's the problem... to being different? Even if Vincent-sama is a Baskerville, as you say, even if he is completely different from me, it doesn't matter. I don't care if we're different! And if he really is that different, that's just one more reason to try to understand him!

author: Madarame Ikkaku
title: Bleach
text: No man's life is worth more than another! If you're gonna put your life on the line, you do it as equals! I don't care if you're brothers, or master and apprentice, or whatever! You should only die for a guy who'd die for you! There's nothing honorable about throwing your life away as though it's nothing! That's just showing off like a kid.

author: Nanako
title: Houkago no Pleiades
text: Space extends infinitely. The probability of an encounter may be low, but it isn't nonexistent.

author: Armin Arlelt
title: Shingeki no Kyojin
text: Willpower alone isn't enough in battle.

author: Natsume Takeshi
title: Natsume Yuujinchou
text: I may not have anywhere to go... but I can't just selfishly disappear either.

author: Natsume Takeshi
title: Natsume Yuujinchou
text: No one could understand the fear of walking alone in this unstable world.

author: Lavi
title: D.Gray-man
text: There isn't anyone who doesn't feel regret or sadness.

author: Furudo Erika
title: Umineko no Naku Koro ni
text: For the first time, I felt honoured at being allowed to compete in this game of truth and error, and witches as a human... And ironically, that taught me that the truth is not necessarily only one when I believed that only one truth existed. By just broadening my field of vision a little, I can see a truth that is completely different. And no matter which one of the truths, if you can only see one of them, they will not be the right answer... Ah, in my life until now, I wonder how many truths have I turned away from because I was blinded by some trivial truth...? This is... the truth... of the world...

author: Shoji Endo
title: NANA
text: What am I to you anyway? You get all teary eyed whenever it suits you but you never stop to think about my feelings and how you might be messing with my heart. You want some nice guy to be a part of your life but only if its on your terms. All this talk of just being friends with a guy... don't make me laugh!

author: Killua Zoldyck
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: Who wants to have their life planned out for them.

author: Yoshimura
title: Tokyo Ghoul √A
text: Life is a succession of committing sin. Life is evil itself. I'm conscious that I'm evil. And so are all of you.

author: Okabe Rintarou
title: Steins;Gate
text: Keep the past, for all intents and purposes, where it is.

author: Ukitake Jyuushirou
title: Bleach
text: Friends are a good thing, even if they tread a different path.

author: Hisoka
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: It takes a mere second for treasure to turn to trash.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: What if, and this is strictly hypothetical, what if you could reload your save data to change your previous choice, like in a game? Would it change your life? The answer is a resounding no.

author: Kazuki Kazami
title: Grisaia no Kajitsu
text: It's too soon to give up. We aren't in Hell yet. This world is still worth surviving for.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: A problem is not a problem as long as nobody sees it as one.

author: Archer
title: Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works TV
text: Brilliant people shine more brightly than ordinary ones. They never regret or agonize over what they've done.

author: Yuuji Kazami
title: Grisaia no Rakuen
text: A little bit of trouble keeps life from being boring.

author: Mei Misaki
title: Another
text: How does it feel to not exist?

author: Mei Misaki
title: Another
text: If you're here, can you prove you're really here?

author: Esdeath
title: Akame ga KILL!
text: Panicking leads to an early grave.

author: Mami Tomoe
title: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica
text:
If you use your wish to grant someone else's, you should be careful you know exactly why you are doing it.
Are you really doing it for someone else's benefit?
Or the opposite, you're doing it for that person's everlasting gratitude.

author: Featherine Augustus Aurora
title: Umineko no Naku Koro ni
text: People respect it when someone they are distant from is boring and harmless. However, they only like that person because he or she doesn't get in their way. No human would want to hang around a boring person.

author: Tomoko Kuroki
title: WATAMOTE
text: Resenting the past won't change anything. It just makes me want to kill myself! I have some control over my future, but there's no changing the past! I'll simply do what I can right now.

author: Kariya Jin
title: Bleach
text: Let me tell you the truth. The truth behind fighting. Fighting continues forever. After you've defeated one person, someone stronger appears. If you manage to defeat him, then an even stronger person comes along. If you don't have the resolve to endure that eternal struggle, then eventually your confidence will erode. But it doesn't end there! The battle will continue elsewhere, fought by others. It's an endless cycle! And it doesn't end with a person's death. The cycle will continue! As long as people and their souls exist, there will be disputes and those disputes will lead to fights. And those fights will continue without limit, for all eternity.

author: Natsume Takeshi
title: Natsume Yuujinchou
text: There were a lot of people who were kind to begin with. No, they were probably good people but, I don't want to see the disappointment in their eyes anymore. I don't really want to meet kind of people anymore.

author: Frederica Bernkastel
title: Umineko no Naku Koro ni
text: The reader will be me. I have no love, maybe I'll end up interpreting some things in a weird way. However, the reader is free to decide how to read things and with which intonation.

author: Misa Amane
title: Death Note
text: Unless someone makes the first move, nothing will happen.

author: Kyoko Mogami
title: Skip Beat!
text: When you love someone, you can never be sure that you'll be loved in return.

author: Don Kanonji
title: Bleach
text: Run? Is that how you speak to a hero? How little you understand. Allow me to educate you. If a hero were to run from battle... the children could no longer call him a hero.

author: Zaraki Kenpachi
title: Bleach
text: It's been so long that I forgot the pain of not having a name. Everyone had a name that friends use to call them, but I didn't. That pain.

author: Hange Zoe
title: Shingeki no Kyojin
text: If there's something you don't understand, learn to understand it.

author: Alphonse Elric
title: Fullmetal Alchemist
text: You're not a good-for-nothing person. I think that being able to try your hardest to be something is a talent by itself.

author: Greed
title: Fullmetal Alchemist
text: Greed may not be good, but it's not so bad either. You humans think greed is just for money or power, but everyone wants something they can't have.

author: Undertaker
title: Kuroshitsuji
text: How sad it would be if laughter should disappear.

author: Astharoshe Asran
title: Trinity Blood
text: It is so painful when you lose someone you love ...To the point where your hair turns white because of grief.

author: Itsuki Minami
title: Air Gear
text: Nothing can remain the same forever, because if you don't change you can't improve... Facing this inescapable ''reality'' if you don't grow... You'll be crushed... For everyone to ascend and accomplish their dreams. They must grow.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: I'm always alone. Other people don't factor into what I do. The things that happen in front of me are parts of my life and my life alone.

author: Maka Albarn
title: Soul Eater
text: You're the one who decides who you are.

author: Toboe
title: Wolf's Rain
text: Why does everybody have to fight about everything, argue and steal from each other all the time? I mean, it's a big enough world. Why can't we share it?

author: Alice
title: Pandora Hearts
text: If you don't get accepted by anyone, does that mean there's no significance for you to live on?

author: Vincent Volaju
title: Cowboy Bebop
text: I have no fear of death. It just means dreaming in silence. A dream that lasts for eternity

author: Kurosaki Ichigo
title: Bleach
text: [After getting hit by Yammy Llargo's Bala] You mean do I have a defence? Truth is, I've never really had any plans against any attacks. I just knew I had to win so I did. That's my plan. I don't care if you're higher ranked than the other Espadas' were, to me it's all the same. I've gotta defeat you so I'll find a way to do it. Simple.

author: Karma Akabane
title: Assassination Classroom
text: If you've got time to point fingers, then how about using your head to figure out what you want to do about it?

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Food tastes best when you don't have to work for it.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text:
Merits, demerits, risks, returns; if they were these things then I understood. I could understand.

Desire and self-protection, hatred from jealousy. I could analyze the mentality of the actions that were grounded on these abundant, repulsive emotions. That's because I had plenty of those ugly feelings inside of me. That's why it was simple to imagine. if they were similar things, then there was still room to understand it. I could explain using logic.

However, if there wasn't, then it was difficult.

Without the concept of profit and loss, it was hard to imagine the feelings of people who went beyond people who went beyond logic and theory. I had too little to go on and above all else. I had committed too many mistakes up until now.

Good will, friendship, or even love; they were all things I had been mistaken with. I was sure that I was mistaken with them even now as I thought about them.

author: Sehara
title: One thousand and one nights
text: When I thought that I would never see you again. I was crippled by the pain of my heart being shattered. For the first time, I came to realize that "Heartbreak" was not just a word in books.

author: Kodaka Hasegawa
title: Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai NEXT
text: You know what, I wish I could give everyone a happy ending. But life isn't some romantic anime and I can't fix what's wrong in life stumbling around being oblivious and nice all the time.

author: Biscuit Krueger
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: There are liars who only lie when there's a reason to, and there are liars who also lie without a reason.

author: Minato
title: Houkago no Pleiades
text: Do you dislike that someone you once knew has become someone new without your knowing?

author: Aladdin
title: Magi - The Labyrinth of Magic
text: If you keep lying like that, no one, not even yourself, will believe you anymore.

author: Takashi Natsume
title: Natsume's Book of Friends
text: What's been troubling me lately are these small farewells that make me feel a bit lonely. Brief meetings and farewells. I want to treasure each and every moment.

author: Akashi Seijuurou
title: Kuroko's Basketball TV 3
text: I have not changed at all. There were two of me to begin with. It was merely a swap between us. I have no intent on hiding this. Whether or not you believe it is up to you, Tetsuya. However, if you want to call it a "change", then that was because it was necessary. The team did not change because I had changed. I changed because the team had changed.

author: Akiyama Shinichi
title: Liar Game
text: Humans, in general, feel uneasy when there's dissonance between them and their external environment. And so, to cancel that uneasiness they try to synchronize (or make peace) with that environment.

author: Ging Freecss
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: If I can get my target to move as I want, I've succeeded as a Hunter.

author: Meruem
title: Hunter X Hunter
text: Ha-ha these humans are definitely foolish creatures.  Think as hard as those weak brains of yours can manage. Do you humans ever listen to the cries of mercy coming from pigs and cows you slaughter?

author: Sehara
title: One thousand and one nights
text: We each have an arrow in our hearts that we cannot remove.

author: Takeshi Tatsumi
title: Giant Killing
text: Where's the fun in it if everything is going just as planned?

author: Tsukune Aono
title: Rosario Vampire
text: Our differences are what let us understand each other. We've worked together to come this far, there are no doubts or regret anymore. I'll overcome this fight and prove that even we can come to an understanding.

author: Takeshi Tatsumi
title: Giant Killing
text: Do your best, no matter how many times you fail!

author: Shinji Ikari
title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
text: No one can justify life by linking happy moments into a rosary.

author: Vash the Stampede
title: Trigun
text: It is a virtue to devote one's self to something, firmly believing in one's own ideals. But that does not mean it's alright to belittle the ideals or feelings of others. If you lead such a busy life and you don't realize how your parents feel, it's only self-satisfaction. It's alright to stop every now and again, if you want a moment's rest, if you want to feel what other people feel.

author: Aozaki Touko
title: Kara no Kyoukai
text: A rose will be born a rose. Different soil and water wouldn't change it into a different flower.

author: Lain Iwakura
title: Serial Experiments Lain
text: If you're not remembered, then you never existed.

author: Mello
title: Death Note
text: Oh, I almost forgot. In the event that anyone besides big-headed Near or the deluded murderer is reading these notes, then I should at least perform the basic courtesy of introducing myself, here at the end of the prologue. I am your narrator, your navigator, your storyteller. For anyone else but those two, my identity may be of no interest, but I am the old world's runner-up, the best dresser that died like a dog, Mihael Keehl. I once called myself Mello and was addressed by that name, but that was a long time ago.

author: L Lawliet
title: Death Note
text: There is no heaven or hell. No matter what you do while you're alive, everybody goes to the same place once you die. Death is Equal.

author: Rika Noyamano
title: Air Gear
text: From the past... I always wanted to ask. God, why... Are you so unfair and extremely cruel? Why do you separate those who can fly... And those who cannot and bring them into existence? Why, in this one world... You made the effort to divide them into two and bring them together? In reality everyone was born with wings!.. Why didn't I realize that until now? It's not that those who can fly are able to fly, but that those who think of flying... Those who believe they can fly are the ones who can fly.

author: Kanzaki Nao
title: Liar Game
text: Saying humans can't be trusted, please never use such words again!

author: Yuuko Ichihara
title: xxxHOLiC
text: If you've decided that you can't do it even before you act, you have already made it into something impossible.

author: Hayato Mikogami
title: Sekirei
text: This is exactly why I detest adults! You always have such a parochial approach, always trying to force the rules of your petty world onto others!

author: Sehara
title: One thousand and one nights
text: It takes more courage to speak the truth than it does to wield a sword.

author: Minerva Orland
title: Fairy Tail
text: Manipulating the pieces according to your strategy... That is what defines a King.

author: Itsuki Minami
title: Air Gear
text: Sure, it might be warm and comfortable in there... not only safe and sound, but I get all the meals too! But I'd rather be out than be trapped inside this bird cage of yours.

author: Rika Noyamano
title: Air Gear
text: No matter what kind of 'strength' you possess. There are places you can never reach no matter how hard you try. The farther it is... The higher it is...

author: Erwin Smith
title: Shingeki no Kyojin
text: If we only focus on making the best moves, we will never get the better of our opponent. When necessary, we must be willing to take big risks, and be prepared to lose everything. Unless we change how we fight, we cannot win.

author: Makishima Shougo
title: Psycho-Pass Extended Edition
text: Aging is quite similar to death. Some people stand up to aging and death as if it were nothing. They can do it not because they're braver than others, but simply because they lack imagination. Only once people deny that which they love, do they become able to create it anew. Perhaps, the book I write, too, will die one day just like my body will. However, people have to accept that death is unavoidable. They will probably be gone in ten years. Their books will no longer exist in a hundred years. People accept this. Eternity is promised neither to humans nor to books. We live because we were born. If the system possesses the power of life and death over you... you're no longer a human. You're livestock. No matter how hard a rancher tries to pretend otherwise, they never recognize their livestock as friends. It's a mystery to me... How is it that these people, treated as livestock in this boring society, have not tried at all to destroy it? Nothing in this world is eternal. The only thing that truly exists is the splendor of the souls that atone for their sins.

author: Sehara
title: One thousand and one nights
text: You cannot understand that which you do not know, and that misunderstanding breeds hatred.

author: Sarasvati
title: Kore wa Zombie Desu ka? of the Dead
text: You hide a tree by putting it in a forest; you hide a person among other people!

author: Medaka Kurokami
title: Medaka Box
text: "To enjoy what one loves to do". Those words come easily from the mouth. But it's another thing to help them grow.

author: Yukino Yukinoshita
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: Even if we know each other, understanding each other is another matter.

author: Yuuji Kazami
title: Grisaia no Meikyuu
text: They say you never know when a bullet you fired in battle will find its way back to you.

author: Hachiman Hikigaya
title: Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru. Zoku
text: That's not exactly right. If you had to sacrifice many things to protect one, you're more likely to give up and throw it away. Including relationships you have in your hand now.

author: Ayumu Aikawa
title: Kore wa Zombie Desu ka? of the Dead
text: Ah... Everything is such a bother. Even living.

author: Moroha Haimura
title: Seiken Tsukai no World Break
